entityId.localType: State Records of South Australia Series ID

nameEntry.part: Register of admissions and discharges (mothers) - McBride Maternity Hospital

biogHist.abstract: The series Register of admissions and discharges (mothers) - McBride Maternity Hospital 1926 - c.1964 includes two registers of admission and discharges for the McBride Maternity Hospital. The registers record all adults in the Hospital at the beginning of each year and admissions and discharges for each week.
biogHist.p: A Research Centre Members card, obtainable at the Archives, is required to research records held at State Records.

Although some very early records relating to children in care in South Australia are open for access, most records relating to children are subject to a 100 year restriction, particularly those which contain personal information about individuals. Written permission must be obtained from the government agency which created the record in order to access restricted material. To obtain permission a Freedom of Information (FOI) request form must be submitted to the relevant government department. State Records staff will be able to assist you with this.

In the first volume entries for admissions include number, name, date and remarks. Entries for discharges include number, name, date and address. The first volume also contains loose sheets recording weekly statistics of the numbers of adults and babies in the Hospital from 1954 to 1957, and admissions and discharges of mothers and babies from 1960 to 1964. Entries for both admissions and discharges in the second volume give date and name only. Entries for married women use the surname only. There is a gap for the period 1934 to 1954.
